definition: to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: You have a cold, so you must keep quiet at home.
sentences.chinese: 你得了感冒，所以必須在家裏靜養。

sentences.english: He must have three more weeks of rest before he is released.
sentences.chinese: 他在出院以前，還需要三週時間的靜養。

sentences.english: The patient needs plenty of rest.
sentences.chinese: 那名病人需要長期靜養。

sentences.english: The president will then spend the weekend at his Camp David retreat in Maryland.
sentences.chinese: 然後總統將在馬里蘭的戴維營靜養處度過週末。

definition: to recuperate/to convalesce/to take care of one's health after illness
lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
to feel a chill (as an emotional response)/to feel cold (as a clinical symptom)
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
to die of old age/to die in one's bed at a ripe old age
to take care of (sb's health)/to nurse
variant of 紓壓|纾压[shu1 ya1]
to force someone to do something
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
to preserve and nurture one's spirit (idiom); honing one's strength for the big push
